Welcome back, Game designers!
Are you ready to take a new step
into the world of game creation
Do you remember what we do here? Yes, we use Roblox Studio to
make the games ourselves. This program helps us create and
modify the game world in a very easy and simple way, as we saw
last time
Now, let's learn more about how to build more difficult things.
Let's start building our first game today!
Let’s start working
Open Roblox Studio.
Choose the "Baseplate" template to start creating
Note: Baseplate is an empty world that we can create whatever
we want inside, so we'll select it to start
2

Now your world will open with you and we will be ready to start
building our first world. Let's start creating !
"Can you remember what shows up in this workspace?"
3

menus that we will constantly learn. Now, type the name of each
list.

Any structure consists of main components, and when
assembled, we can build any shape we want. These components
are:
Block
sphere
4

cylinder
wedge
We can easily find those components in Roblox to draw them
within the Model menu in the Toolbox.
Look inside Parts, you will find all the parts we
talked about. You can click on the item you
want and move it into the workspace to start
building
Now that we've placed some
components, we want to adjust
them to create more complex
shapes.
5

Inside the Model menu, there are several options to control and
modify the parts. These options are:
Move: Move parts to any desired location
Scale: Change the size of the parts
Rotate: Rotate the parts at different angles
Using these tools helps us build and modify parts easily, enabling
us to create complex and creative shapes
6

MOVE:
This allows us to change the position of objects in your
workspace.
There are 6 arrows extending from the part, Indicating 6
directions of movement.
Drag the arrows to move the part in the indicated direction.
SCALE:
This tool allows us to adjust the size of blocks and shapes.
When you click on it, 6 circles appear around the part.
Click and drag a circle with the left mouse button to resize
the part.
7

Rotate:
This tool allows us to rotate objects, giving them a new
direction to enhance our designs.
Three circles will appear around the part. Drag one of them
to .rotate the part.
You can also modify the steps from here.
8

If you place a part by mistake and
want to delete it
you can simply remove unwanted
parts by selecting them and pressing
the delete button
Alternatively, you can right-click on
the item and choose the delete
command
It's important for you to gain experience using each tool, so give
them a try yourself.
Shortcuts:
You can move parts by grabbing them from the centre, and
in this case, the Z position will automatically adjust to the
top of the ground.
If you want to zoom in on a specific bloc k, select it
and click "F"
9

Property Adjustment:
Now it's time to adjust properties such as color, material, and
some physical characteristics of the placed parts
All you need to do is choose
the item you want by
making sure the "Select"
command is chosen.
Then click on the item you want. You will see the item's properties
appear, and you can start changing them.
10

Let's explore some of the properties we can modify:
1. Brick Color:
To change the color of the part, find the "Brick Color" property in
the properties window
Choose the color you want from the available list
11

2.Color:
To change the color using the "Color" property, which will give
you more options
3. Cast Shadow:
Choose whether the item has a shadow by enabling or disabling
the property
12

4.Material:
.Change the item's material to change its appearance
Choose from options like plastic, wood, or stone to give items a
unique and realistic look. Enjoy experimenting with these options
Transparency:
To change the transparency of the item, adjust the transparency
value between 0 (fully opaque) and 1 (fully transparent) using the
scrollbar or by manually entering the value
13

Anchored:
And here's the most important
property! In Roblox, objects are affected
by physics like gravity. Choosing
"Anchored" makes them unaffected
and remain fixed in place under all
circumstances
You can lift an object upward and test the game with the
"Anchored" property on and off to see how it behaves differently.
Notice how the object stays still when the property is on, and how
it falls and responds to gravity when it's off.
14

Now let's try to create more advanced parts using these basic
shapes! For example, let's build a tree like this:
Let's take a more simple look at the tree:
Notice of how the tree is built from a tall brown cylinder with a
large green sphere atop it that is decorated with smaller green
spheres
15

Now, simply follow these steps:
1.To start, drag the cylinder shape from the panel and position it
appropriately.
2.Resize it to match the tree trunk's shape.
3. Choose the sphere shape from the parts and position it on top of
the cylinder.
4.Add small spheres around the large sphere to represent leaves.
5.Make sure to adjust the properties of the cylinder, large sphere,
and small spheres using the properties window.
6.Remember to activate the "Anchored" property for all parts to
keep the tree stable and prevent it from falling.
16

Now let's build our first game!
In this game, you need to jump over obstacles to reach the finish
final point without harm.
A quick look at the game reveals it's composed of blocks and
shapes with adjusted properties.

Toolbox:
Now we've reached this point and successfully built all of this
But what about placing a bridge between the obstacles?
Building the bridge might seem simple, but it does take time.
That's where Roblox's Toolbox becomes useful. It's like magic!
Through it, we can find pre-made objects ready to use.
24

Using the Toolbox to add a bridge:
1. Open the Toolbox: Make sure you
have the Toolbox open. If it's not
open, you can open it from the View
menu and selecting Toolbox.
2. Search for a bridge:
Type “Bridge” in the search bar and
press Enter.
3. Select the bridge:
Drag the bridge and place it in a
suitable location between the
obstacles in the game path.in the
game path.
4. Adjust the bridge:
Use editing tools (such as moving, rotating, and scaling) to adjust the
bridge to fit the game design. Ensure to modify the properties of the
bridge and make it Anchored to keep it stable in its place.
25

To change the sky:
simply search for "Sky" in the Tool
